archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Tofu, Shiitake & Bok Choy Miso Soup with Jasmine Rice
description: A light, comforting miso soup loaded with tofu, shiitake, and bok choy, served with fluffy jasmine rice. Mild, vegetable-forward, and ready in about 25 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs mostly clear.
Slice 6 oz shiitake mushrooms (stems removed if tough).
Chop 2 small heads bok choy, separating stems and leafy tops.
Slice 3 spring onion (greens and whites separated).
cook_steps: Add 2.25 cups water and the rinsed jasmine rice to a pot; bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook 12–15 minutes until tender; rest covered 5 minutes.
In a separate pot, combine 2 cups mushroom broth and 4 cups water; bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
Add minced garlic, sliced shiitake, and the white parts of spring onion; simmer 3–4 minutes until mushrooms soften.
Stir in bok choy stems; simmer 2 minutes. Add bok choy leaves; simmer 1 minute.
Ladle 1 cup hot broth into a bowl and whisk in 3 tablespoons miso paste until smooth.
Turn heat to low (avoid boiling). Gently add tofu cubes and the miso mixture back to the pot. Warm 1–2 minutes without boiling.
Taste and add a pinch of white pepper if desired. Top soup with spring onion greens.
Fluff rice and serve bowls of soup alongside scoops of jasmine rice.
